result.rationale: The species is endemic to Lake Albert with an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 7,997 km<sup>2</sup>. There is habitat degradation due to activities in the catchment and  pollution from oil and gas developments in the Albertine graben. There is a single location based on these threats. Therefore, this species is assessed as Vulnerable.
result.geographicrange: The species is endemic to Lake Albert. Recent records of the species are available at RMCA (Vranken et al. 2020).
result.population: No information is available on the population size and trend.
result.habitat: It is a benthopelagic species, occurring in a lacustrine environment (Froese and Pauly 2021). It is not a migrant (Froese and Pauly 2021). No other information is available on its life history, feeding and reproductive biology.
result.threats: There is habitat degradation due to activities in the catchment and pollution from oil and gas developments in the Albertine graben (Wandera and Balirwa 2010).
result.conservationmeasures: Conservation actions are not known to be in place for this species.
result.usetrade: There is no use or trade information for this species.
